betterquesting:10.desc:8:
An animal's mood is what dictates the animal's aggression level. Some animals enjoy large groups; others will not like it. Some animals don't like being placed with incompatible species. An animal's mood can be seen in the DinoPedia.

50 to 99 is Content. The animal will not attack you unless you attack first. 100 is Happy, but there is no difference between the two moods.

-49 to 49 is Calm. Herbivores will only attack when provoked, and Carnivores will only attack when hungry. Spinosaurus, Sarcosuchus, Ceratosaurus, Liopleurodon, Mosasaurus, and Tyrannosaurus Rex will attack anyway.

-99 to -50 is Sad. The animal will attack everything on sight, regardless of whether it's hungry or not. -100 is Angry, but there is no difference between Sad and Angry. 



To increase an animal's mood:

Give it an Enrichment Item; like the ball, tethered log, or scratching post for land and bubble blower for water. (Bubbleblowers are toggled with redstone and don't require power)

Allow it to kill or hunt something. This raises its mood significantly, especially for Carnivores.

Allowing it to eat a dropped food item.

Hand-feeding it.

Placing enough of the same species near it.

Give them live food(dodo and other vanilla mobs) 



To decrease it:

Attacking it.

Placing too many or too little of the same species near it.

Placing incompatible species near it.

Letting it starve.
